reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights, had a great time hotel very clean and comfortable, prices for drinks are very expensive £2.50 for a small mixer drink i.e coke or sprite.£5 for a coffee. Staff very friendly would definately go again and stay in the same place, 5 min walk to town centre, Capri well worth a trip, as is pompei,and the volcano. All in all a beautiful place well worth a visit and we will be going again, trains and busses easy to use if needed and resort hoppa were extreamly good for getting you from the airport to the resort or hotel.If you go for the first time it's well worth paying and saving yourself from loads of hassle.,
reviews.title: Bella Bella

reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Gardenia during a grey,wet and cool Italian winter. The hotel was a warm and welcoming place, with very comfortable and well appointed rooms. A family booking, our teenage children were placed next to us as requested. Our fantastic hosts went out of their way to make us welcome in their beautiful city. Free transfers to more 'out of the way' restaurants were arranged for us, making the stay in a rainy period far more comfortable. We will recommend this hotel to all our friends.
reviews.title: wonderful stay, comfortable rooms, fantastic hosts

reviews.text: Hotel Gardenia is a good budget hotel. It is located just outside of the main town so you need to walk into town, where there are no sidewalks, and cars and motorcycles whiz by you all the time, so you need to walk single file. The town of Sorrento is a great town to walk around and has lots of things to do. The pool at the hotel was good except that they do not provide towels, and you are not even allowed to use your hotel towels! That made using the pool very inconvenient as you could rent a towel for 10euros!
reviews.title: Hotel Gardenia - good budget hotel

likes.disliked: — ants, and lack of pool towels

reviews.text: ALso, we had ants in our room when we came in and they sprayed the room, but then we had to endure the smell of the pesticide - not the best way to enjoy a vacation.
reviews.title: Gardenia was Great!

reviews.text: ALso taxis are very expensive. We were charged 20euros for a short 5 minute trip to the marina. Ask before you get in what the rate is and bargain.
reviews.title: We will be back this fall !

reviews.text: Very impressed by the cleanliness and facilities at Hotel Gardenia.Was not sure what to expect and with two young children it is always a challenge to find a place that is welcoming to the young ones.Needless to say the children loved their stay and in particular the pool area which provided welcome releif after a long hot day of sightseeing.
reviews.title: Return to Sorrento

likes.liked: — Very Clean,very organised and very affordable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is a short walk away from some great restaurants and the main square Piazza Tasso.Let me say you will need to walk after sampling some great food in Sorrento.Dont forget to call in and say hello at Il Leone Rosso Ristorante,very affordable and top quality.Dont forget to try the Parmigiana......delicious.
reviews.title: Gardenia, The Best of Sorrento

likes.liked: — Location, staff, services, efficiency of front desk, breakfast, etc.

reviews.text: Back to Hotel Gardenia.Been there done that....and will definately be staying there again.In a few short words.Extremely Clean,Welcoming,great breakfast,great location and very good value for money.Great Place to stay. RG Sydney Australia
reviews.title: Great Hotel Gardenia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our third visit to Sorrento.....and our third stay at the Hotel Gardenia. This family run hotel is one of the most accommodating we have experienced during our 15 years of travelling Italy. Organized and efficient, the staff is very willing to assist you with your daily needs. The breakfast that is included in the cost of the room is one of the best we ever received. Fresh fruit, homemade baked goods, and eggs among other goodies. To add to our delight, the hotel has a large, well-maintained outdoor swimming pool.
reviews.title: Very friendly and helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A three star hotel with reasonable rates, and a good location. You are a short distance (walkable for some) from the Train and Bus Station and the city center.
reviews.title: Well run but not exceptional

likes.liked: — The food at the pool bar
likes.disliked: — The situation on a busy road and the fact that there was no view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As indicated by previous reviewers, The Gardenia is situated a fifteen minute walk from town along the busiest road imaginable, the air constantly polluted by traffic fumes. If you had children, I can imagine getting them from a to b would be very difficult. On first appearance, the hotel appeared to be clean and fresh, the pool area did look nice and we were glad to be overlooking the rear of the hotel. However, our room appeared to have an ant infestation and on our third and last night when we removed the bedside cabinet to investigate further, we were shocked to find that this area had not been cleaned for some considerable time. Our balcony was never swept (we knew this because we kept our eye on a piece of bread left by some previous occupant). At no time did we have any food in our room. When I reported the ant situation on check out, the receptionist looked at me and repeated 'ants in the room' looked away and made no further mention of it! We do have high standards, I will admit but compared to our hotels in Amalfi, Capri and even Naples, this was the least inviting.
reviews.title: Don't stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having travelled extensively on business around the world, how lucky we were to find this gem for our 10 day Sorrento Holiday. Well positioned location, comfortable, well finished rooms, with views of the Bay of Naples. Breakfast served at the hotel is an absolute must before starting out on your day. The pool is both large and crystal clear with a nice poolside snack bar. Check out the view from the roof top viewing area.
reviews.title: Good location with exceptional warm friendly Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We all know that it is the Hotel staff that can really make a holiday totally memorable. The staff are extremely warm and friendly, giving great advice for Day Tours, Where to Eat and Where to Go. The guys organised a half day Italian Farm Tour where we got to sample home grown produce - ( an absolute must ).
reviews.title: Clean modern hotel

reviews.text: Hotel Gardenia is a ten minute walk to Sorrento's Train & Bus Terminal which is your key transport hub for Airport Transfers and Day Trip Transport connections for Bus, Coach, Train and Ferry tranfer access for the Amalfi Coast.
reviews.title: Well-located, clean, comfortable, family-owned hotel.

reviews.text: We highly recommend Hotel Gardenia for all it has to offer and look forward to staying again one day , all the way from - Sydney, Australia.
reviews.title: Pros and cons

reviews.text: We have visited the Hotel Gardenia several times and can only give our whole hearted thanks to the wonderful staff-some of the nicest and most helpful people we have ever encountered on our travels!
reviews.title: Superb sevice nad a great base for exploring the region...

likes.liked: — The Staff and the food,fantastic access and a great swimming pool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first time we visited was our 10th wedding anniversary and we were astonished by the beauty of the coastal drive into the town.
reviews.title: Recommnend It

likes.disliked: — Location on main road into Sorrento

reviews.text: On arrival at the Gardenia the staff ensured that our belongings were swiftly ushered to our room and we were offered coffee which was most welcome.
reviews.title: Simply Excellent

likes.liked: — The combination of all the things

reviews.title: Loved it!
reviews.text: The room we had was a decent size with excellent facilities and it looked as if it had just been refurbished.We had our own balcony which looked down onto a garden full of lemon trees.

Sorrento at night or day is very busy-Italian 'amore di vita' means that vehicles whizz around at all times and there is a definate 'buzz' about Sorrento,however is this ever became too obtrusive we could just close the double glazed balcony door and chill out with the excellent air conditioning...most welcome.
reviews.title: Bad Luck?
Bit too far away!
reviews.text: I feel like Im the only one who didnt fall in love with this place.
It is very clean and the renovated rooms are fine. After speaking to other patrons I belive at the time we stayed there, that some of the rooms at the back of the hotel where not renovated.
reviews.title: The BEST experience in Italy

reviews.text: We where travelling with children and requested rooms next to each other, which we always do and pretty much is never a problem. But at this hotel they put us on the same floor but at other ends of the hotel and couldnt understand why I was having a problem with that. Whilst trying to sought out the problem I picked up the word 'stupido' being mentioned between the two hotel staff having the conversation which wasnt much appreciated. I suppose we must have gone at a busy time because they where unable to accomodate my request.
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Great Location

reviews.text: If I went back to Sorrento I would stay on the same street but closer to the water. Its quite a hike to get back and forth and the taxis in Sorrento are more expensive than other places.
reviews.title: Loved the Gardenia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just a note if you are going to capri, you can hire your own speed boat for little in comparison to what the tours charge you to see the grottos and we found this to be one of the best days we had on our two month trip. Although my husband had a boat license your not required to have one and by the end of the day even our 9 & 11 year olds where driving the boat. Take your bathers and you can anchor down and swim into the caves around the water.
reviews.title: Very good experience
